intro: Polychilos mysorensis, commonly known as the Mysore polychilos, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
